Package Server

Class Databaseedit

  • java.lang.Object
    • Server.Databaseedit
  • public class Databaseedit
extends java.lang.Object
    The Databaseedit class provides methods for connecting to a MySQL database, executing SQL queries, and handling database operations related to the GoNature application.
    Author:
    Pier Mbariky, Redan Ganim, Bassel Haddad, Joel Hourany, Asaad Sajim, Nadine Halabi

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static java.sql.Connection conn
      The connection to the MySQL database.

      Databaseedit()

        The connection to the MySQL database.

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • ConnectToDB

        public static java.lang.String ConnectToDB​(java.lang.String name,
                                           java.lang.String username,
                                           java.lang.String password)
                                    throws java.text.ParseException
        Establishes a connection to the MySQL database.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the database
        username - the username for database authentication
        password - the password for database authentication
        Returns:
        "success" if the connection is successful, "error" otherwise
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - if there is an error parsing date and time strings

      • showOrders

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Order> showOrders​(java.lang.String email)
        Retrieves a list of orders associated with the provided email.
        Parameters:
        email - the email address of the user whose orders are to be retrieved
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of Order objects representing the orders associated with the provided email
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs or the SQL query is invalid

      • searchForAccount

        public static Traveler searchForAccount​(java.lang.String id)
        Searches for a traveler's account based on the provided ID and returns the corresponding Traveler object. If the traveler is logged in elsewhere, returns null.
        Parameters:
        id - The unique identifier of the traveler's account.
        Returns:
        A Traveler object representing the traveler's account if found and not logged in elsewhere, or null if the traveler is logged in elsewhere or if the account does not exist.

      • searchForEmpAccount

        public static Employee searchForEmpAccount​(java.lang.String[] fields)
                                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Searches for an employee's account based on the provided fields (username and password) and returns the corresponding Employee object.
        Parameters:
        fields - An array containing the username and password of the employee's account.
        Returns:
        An Employee object representing the employee's account if found and not logged in elsewhere, or an Employee object with the message "alreadylogged" if the employee is already logged in elsewhere, or null if the account does not exist.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If an SQL exception occurs during database operations.

      • trytoaddorder

        public static java.lang.String trytoaddorder​(Order order)
                                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Tries to add an order to the database and returns a status message indicating the outcome.
        Parameters:
        order - The Order object representing the order to be added.
        Returns:
        A status message indicating the outcome of the operation: - "alreadyhaveorder" if the user already has an order for the specified park within the allowed time frame. - "unsuccess" if the order cannot be added due to insufficient capacity or an SQL exception. - "success" if the order is successfully added to the database.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If an SQL exception occurs during database operations.

      • addUser

        public static java.lang.String addUser​(Traveler traveler)
                                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Adds a new traveler to the database.
        Parameters:
        traveler - The Traveler object representing the traveler to be added.
        Returns:
        A status message indicating the outcome of the operation: - "success" if the traveler is successfully added to the database. - "unsuccess" if the traveler cannot be added due to an SQL exception or if the traveler already exists in the database.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If an SQL exception occurs during database operations.

      • logout

        public static java.lang.String logout​(java.lang.String id)
                               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Logs out a user by updating the 'logged_in' status in the database.
        Parameters:
        id - The unique identifier of the user to be logged out.
        Returns:
        A status message indicating the outcome of the operation: - "success" if the user is successfully logged out. - "unsuccess" if the user cannot be logged out due to an SQL exception or if the user does not exist.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If an SQL exception occurs during database operations.

      • deleteOrder

        public static java.lang.String deleteOrder​(Order orderToDelete)
                                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Deletes an order from the database and inserts it into the 'canceledorders' table.
        Parameters:
        orderToDelete - The Order object representing the order to be deleted.
        Returns:
        A status message indicating the outcome of the operation: - "success" if the order is successfully deleted from the database and inserted into the 'canceledorders' table. - "unsuccess" if the order cannot be deleted or if an SQL exception occurs.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If an SQL exception occurs during database operations.

      • addtowaitlist

        public static java.lang.Integer[] addtowaitlist​(Order ord)
                                         throws java.sql.SQLException
        Adds an order to the waitlist in the database and returns the number of orders on the waitlist.
        Parameters:
        ord - The Order object representing the order to be added to the waitlist.
        Returns:
        An array containing two integers: - The first integer represents the ID of the added order. - The second integer represents the number of orders on the waitlist for the specified park and time.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If an SQL exception occurs during database operations.

      • updatewaitlist

        public static void updatewaitlist​(Order order)
                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Updates the waitlist by moving orders to the confirmed orders list based on available capacity.
        Parameters:
        order - The Order object representing the order details.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If an SQL exception occurs during database operations.

      • checkpark

        public static int checkpark​(java.lang.String parkName)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Checks the availability of a park for visitation based on the current number of visitors and existing orders.
        Parameters:
        parkName - The name of the park to check availability for.
        Returns:
        The available capacity of the park for visitation.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If an SQL exception occurs during database operations.

      • checkuserType

        public static int checkuserType​(java.lang.String id)
                         throws java.sql.SQLException
        Checks the type of user approval for group guide based on the provided ID.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the user to check.
        Returns:
        An integer representing the approval status. Returns 0 if no approval found.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database access error occurs.

      • visits

        public static int visits​(Order ord)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Records a visit order and updates the current visitors count for the park.
        Parameters:
        ord - The order object representing the visit details.
        Returns:
        The ID of the recorded order.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database access error occurs.

                                 throws java.sql.SQLException

        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the order to delete.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database access error occurs.

      • arrivedpreordered

        public static Order arrivedpreordered​(java.lang.String[] orders)
                               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Retrieves details of a pre-ordered visit if the visitor arrived within the allowed time range.
        Parameters:
        orders - An array containing the order details.
        Returns:
        An Order object representing the pre-ordered visit details, or null if not found.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database access error occurs.

      • parkvisitallowtime

        public static int parkvisitallowtime​(java.lang.String parkName)
                              throws java.sql.SQLException
        Retrieves the time limit for park visits based on the provided park name.
        Parameters:
        parkName - The name of the park to retrieve the visit time limit.
        Returns:
        The time limit for park visits in hours.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database access error occurs.

                                                                 throws java.sql.SQLException

        Parameters:
        ord - The order object representing the visit details.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of AvailableOrders objects representing available visit times.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database access error occurs.

      • checkEmail

        public static int checkEmail​(java.lang.String email)
        Checks if an email exists in the database.
        Parameters:
        email - The email address to check.
        Returns:
        0 if the email exists, otherwise 1.

      • updateIfComing

        public static void updateIfComing()
                           throws java.sql.SQLException

        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database access error occurs.

        public static void repliestoupdate()
                            throws java.sql.SQLException

        public static CanceledReport getcanceled()

        Returns:
        A CanceledReport object containing canceled order statistics.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database access error occurs.

      • createtotalreport

        public static TotalVisitorsReport createtotalreport​(java.lang.String[] park)
                                             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates a total visitors report for a park for the last 30 days.
        Parameters:
        park - The name of the park to generate the report for.
        Returns:
        A TotalVisitorsReport object containing total visitors statistics.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database access error occurs.

                          throws java.sql.SQLException

        Parameters:
        request - The request object to add.
        Returns:
        True if the request was successfully added, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database access error occurs.

      • parkFullReport

      • addReport

        public static int addReport​(java.lang.String parkName,
                            java.lang.String reportType,
                            java.lang.String sender)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Adds a report to the database.
        Parameters:
        parkName - The name of the park the report is for.
        reportType - The type of the report.
        sender - The sender of the report.
        Returns:
        The ID of the added report, or -1 if the report already exists.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database access error occurs.

        Returns:
        True if the request was successfully applied, otherwise false.

      • exitVisitors

        public static boolean exitVisitors​(int id)
                            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Updates the exit time of visitors and adjusts the current number of visitors in the park.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the visit to be updated.
        Returns:
        true if the exit time was successfully updated, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database access error occurs.

        Parameters:
        userName - The username of the employee to be logged out.
        Returns:
        true if the employee was successfully logged out, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database access error occurs.
        java.lang.Exception

        public static boolean approveGuide​(java.lang.String id)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if the request was successfully approved, false otherwise.

        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the guide request to be denied.
        Returns:
        true if the request was successfully denied, false otherwise.
